text:
1. Topics are usually provided or I might just carry out a relevant search and find something interesting to write about.

2. The next step is research. I usually go through some of the top posts that appear in search for the topic. Check what sections and sub-sections they've included. 

3. I take a look at the “People also ask” section on Google for ideas as well.

4. Then just decide on a structure for the post and start writing. Of course, a lot of research goes into finding facts and points to include.

5. After the first draft, I always review it myself and make little changes wherever necessary . Create a feature image + any graphics to go with the post. 

6. Then it goes for approval sometimes. If that's not required, I can go ahead and publish it.

Quickly and efficiently depends on a lot of things, including how driven I'm feeling on a particular day.

But I do use a content creation platform, Narrato, that helps speed things up a little. For instance, I can generate SEO briefs there so the keyword research and related questions etc. are more or less sorted (I do top it up with more KW research on Ubersuggest sometimes). Also, it offers grammar and readability suggestions which are much needed. This is the tool - <https://narrato.io/|https://narrato.io/>

Apart from that, I make it a point to finish the blog post the same day, unless it is excessively long. 

That helps me maintain the flow. The next day I can look at it with fresh eyes when reviewing . 

I totally agree with <@U01AU94TABA> about setting tight deadlines for yourself. Because it's true what they say - the longer your deadline, the longer the job is going to take.

attachments.fallback: Narrato WorkSpace - Content Creation & Workflow Software
attachments.text: Narrato Workspace is a content creation, collaboration, workflow and project management tool that brings all your content processes and people on a single platform.
attachments.title: Narrato WorkSpace - Content Creation & Workflow Software

text: building your own network that mirrors your personas, social selling and internal advocacy! :slightly_smiling_face:
